title: does riot even read suggestions and discussions on board?
body: no thoughts on this... plain old question..

replies.body: Yes, a lot of us follow the discussion taking place here. It's a great source of feedback. There are a number of other sources we'll also follow as well of course too including 3rd party sites, other official non English speaking LoL forums, direct data collection etc.

Is there a reason that Rioters are quick to post on some threads and hesitant to comment on others? There are obviously certain posts that are bait or solely meant to get a reaction, but there are others that are passionate, but reasonable that don't get any response.

I think a good example is some of the Veigar threads. While quite a few are barely worth paying any attention to, some are very well written and clearly thought out. Usually these ones are merely asking if Veigar is finished or not. A simple yes or no would work wonders.

Anyways, I digress. What is it that a Rioter looks for in a post before deciding that it is okay to respond or not?

One of the biggest thing peoples look at to assess whether they should reply or not is whether the topic's one they can talk about in an informed manner. A really general thread such as 'Who's your favorite mid laner?' is something heaps of Rioters will be able to offer valid thoughts on. Something like 'How do you come up with new skin ideas?' by contrast narrows the pool down to mainly just the people on a single team. At the far end of the spectrum there are then questions like 'Why are you changing X skill's damage by Y' which only a few people will be able answer with context on every detail that went into the decision.

Can you please start replying with general state of balance thoughts so that people can stop having endless debates over which champions are weak and which ones are not? It's kind of ridiculous having to see a constant flood of the same thing over and over again. I feel one good post about the current thoughts on a champion could do a lot in stopping these slug fest of opinion and insults. It would be nice to have a sort of this is where we stand on whether this champion is strong or not.

I'm pretty sure that if he interjected into those conversations he would bias the conversation taking place, at which point he can't use the conversation to learn about what the community thinks about balance. It's often better for them to watch the conversation and adapt their balancing decisions to that rather than interject and state "here is the balance of the game, this is how it is, deal with it".

It would get taken out of context and be misinterpreted. You would get even more annoying threads saying "Look - Riot said so and so, hahahaahhahahaahahhahahahahahah". If you want an example, look at Zed's health.
So, in that regard, who would we speak to regarding the fact that no "Warded" ping has been made?
